CHILDREN.—Children will be there. They will never be engaged in strife or discord. Their love will be fervent 
85
and holy. They will also have a crown of gold upon their heads and a harp in their hands. And their little countenances, that we here see so often troubled and perplexed, will beam with holy joy, expressive of their perfect freedom and happiness.—YI October 1852 quoted in ML 357.
